From: Jim Cheesman <jchees@...>

At 05:36 PM 2/13/2001, you wrote:
>Hello,
>
>Somebody know if JUnit print errors  and fails to a file ?
>
>If yes, how i make this?



I don't know if JUnit itself supports it, but I suggest you download ant 
(from www.apache.org) - it's a build tool (similar to "make" in some ways) 
- using this you can define JUnit as a task; any fails can be sent to a file.
Alternatively, I'd have thought that piping the output to a file would also 
do the job: (On windows, java MyTestClass > myFile.log)


HTH,
Jim
